title: Lekki Conservation Centre
description: A protected nature reserve featuring Africa's longest canopy walkway, birdlife, and walking trails—perfect for family outings and eco-tourism.

title: National Museum Lagos
description: Houses a range of Nigerian heritage collections including traditional art, historical artifacts and curated exhibitions about Nigerian history.

title: Nike Art Gallery
description: One of the largest art galleries in West Africa — galleries, workshops and a colourful marketplace showcasing Nigerian textiles and crafts.

title: Tarkwa Bay Beach
description: A sheltered beach reachable by boat; ideal for swimming, beach sports and picnics away from the city’s bustle.

title: Balogun Market
description: A historic and bustling open market where traders sell textiles, accessories and local wares — a great place to see Lagos trade culture.

title: National Theatre
description: Cultural hub for performing arts — catch theatre productions, film screenings, and occasional festivals celebrating Nigerian arts.

title: Freedom Park
description: A memorial and leisure park on Lagos Island — open-air concerts, markets and a relaxed green space in the city centre.

title: Lekki Arts & Crafts Centre
description: Local artisan stalls, handmade crafts and textile vendors — a perfect stop to support local creative businesses.
